Merge pull request #402 from binsoftware/patch/ios8-psui-size

Handle the larger UICollectionView in iOS 8

Handle the larger UICollectionView in iOS 8.

In addition to increasing padding in PSTCollectionView, this also changes PST class registration so that it does an all-or-nothing superclass replacement of the PSUI*_ classes. This prevents instances like the current case on iOS8-beta 5: PSUICollectionView_ has a superclass of PSTCollectionView, but the other types (e.g. PSUICollectionViewLayout_) had their superclasses replaced with UICollectionView*. This mixed mode is dangerous, as the PST* implementations rely on other PSUI*_ types maintaining their PST* superclasses.

Merge pull request #394 from pkclsoft/master

Corrections/Improvements to selection of items in flow layout
Fixed the way the frame attribute value is maintained.  It was being set such that it's origin was the centre of the view which made it next to impossible to get a meaningful tap detection.

Corrected/improved the hit detection of items within PSTCollectionViewFlowLayout.layoutAttributesArray.

The existing code would return all items in the row tapped rather than just the item.  The new code now correctly adjusts the rectangle used to detect an intersection and only includes those items that intersect.

This seems (to me) to be more consistent with the behaviour of the Apple classes.
Ensure that when setCollectionViewLayout is called, the new layout is used when computing attributes of the contained items.

Merge pull request #329 from retendo/master

Fixed numberOfItemsBeforeSection:
We can ignore cases where the PST class is larger than the UI-class.
The runtime class switcher now checks for the class size and tries to fix situations where the ivar size of the new superclass is different (e.g. potential future iOS updates)
Use dot notation for idempotent methods.

Fix associated object disappearing

The associated object gets cleared out in invalidate layout, so it
makes sense to add it in prepare layout. Otherwise, once the layout has
been invalidated once, the associated object is gone forever and won't
ever be created again.
If the layout isn't prepared, then prepare it when it's about to be used
Removed reuseIdentifier which was no longer used along with two unused methods.
Fix for issue 323. Decoration views do not display properly.

Merge pull request #275 from alexanderedge/master

Delete item causes display corruption in flow layout

Uncomment removing deleted view from visible views dictionary

Since `previouslyVisibleViewsDict` is no longer used, we can safely remove
the deleted view from `_allVisibleViewsDict`.
Fix double 'batchUpdates'
Fix compiler warning - unused variable
Add array backing to illustrate deletion

Assemble a dictionary of views that are to be removed

The previous implementation would check if a given PSTCollectionViewItemKey is
present in the new visible views dictionary. This did not work for the following
case:

Item [0,0]
Item [0,1]
Item [0,2]

Deleting item at [0,1] should result in the alpha fade and eventual removal
from the superview and recycle, but actually since [0,1] is a valid index in the
new layout, [0,2] gets removed instead.

This solution adds views that are to be deleted into a specific NSDictionary
that gets enumerated after all animations are finished. All views contained
inside are recycled.
Set indexPath regardless of if it is present in the new model

Modify UIView's frame instead of CALayer's frame in applyLayoutAttributes:

Modify frame/center instead of layer.frame/layer.position.
Changing the CALayer's frame instead of the UIView's frame prevents the subviews from resizing correctly. This can result in an incorrectly-sized contentView and other views that have been added to the view hierarchy.

Add support for alignment; now defaults to justify (as it's default in UICollectionView)
Note that alignmentOptions is a private API; there still exists a delegate flag so I assume Apple was thinking about having this private API, and the code is still there; however no delegates are called anymore. In PSCollectionView, this is an optional but public API.

Also allows accessing the row coordinates directly; this helps to keep the alignment code in PSGridLayoutRow.
